newsitem.title: USA: CBOE says Thomas Ascher named vice chairman.
newsitem.headline: CBOE says Thomas Ascher named vice chairman.

text.p: The Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE) said Wednesday Thomas Ascher, an independent market maker, was named vice chairman.
Ascher, who has held a seat on the exchange's board of directors since 1994, succeeds William Floersch. Floersch had served six one-year terms as vice chairman.
The CBOE said Ascher will assume the post as well as post of executive committee chairman at its first board meeting of 1997 scheduled for January.
It said Ascher was unopposed for the position.

"My major commitments for the exchange in the year ahead are to continue to capitalize on the vitality and innovation that have distinguished the CBOE and to enhance and strengthen the products and systems that have set us apart," he said in a statement. He added that one CBOE priority is accelerating development of new products. ((Derivatives desk, 3124088750/Email: derivatives@reuters.com))
